result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Dominic Piscitello

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello appeared by video.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Joseph Dominic Piscitello.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing.
Discussions held. Court instructed the State to submit an Amended Criminal Complaint.
Court ordered case adjourned for Initial Appearance & Motion Hearing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Due to Court being down most of 10/7/2022, the motion hearing scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on 10/7/2022 will be rescheduled to 9:30 a.m. on 10/7/2022 by zoom. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello appeared by video.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Joseph Dominic Piscitello.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Victim present via zoom. Arguments heard from State and Defense. For reasons stated on the record Defenses motions are denied. Case is adjourned in Branch 30 to address final defense motion.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Motion to adjourn filed by the state. No objection by defense. Court grants State's motion to adjourn. Matter is rescheduled and parties are notified.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am by zoom.
Notice of Motion to adjourn, filed.
State's Response to Motion to Dismiss

Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello in court via telephone with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Dominic Piscitello appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
All parties appear via zoom.  Status Conference held.  Court to address motions filed by the Defense on the next date.  Parties to appear in person.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion to Dismiss Complaint, filed.
Notice of Motion, Motion to Dismiss, filed.

Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for status. Court in receipt of Defense's motion. Discussion held. Court orders matter adjourned to allow State time to file an amended complaint if needed. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Motion To Make More Definitive and Certain - Bill of Particulars

Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Dominic Piscitello appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Christin Saint Pierre to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning on 6/1/2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (03-06-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MA, TA, LF, SF, DF, TF, JK, AP, and TS.

Defendant Joseph Dominic Piscitello in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30 on 3-22-2022 at 1:30pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph Dominic Piscitello
Current: 724 Maple Street, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2022)
Prior: 1725 South 70th Street Basement, West Allis, WI 53214
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/4/22 @ 2p
